title: What would happen if Google shut down? - Quora

response.answer_text: Google’s assets and infrastructure would simply be sold off. Much of what Google owns now was originally separate companies, and if Google somehow went bankrupt or got broken up in the near future, I envision a scenario along these lines… YouTube gets sold to Amazon, since they have experience with Prime Video and Twitch.Android gets sold to Microsoft, since they have experience competing with Apple, doing Surface hardware, and licensing operating systems to third-party hardware manufacturers.The Chromium open source project continues on without Google, perhaps with a foundation along the lines of the Mozilla Foundation to coordinate things. A lot of people have a vested interest in continuing Chromium development for their own business purposes. People probably switch to Microsoft Edge, Vivaldi, or Brave.AT&T acquires Google’s core search, advertising, and e-mail business, claiming they need it to counter Verizon’s Oath (old AOL/Yahoo/Netscape) acquisition. You may notice little difference at first except a small AT&T copyright notice in the corner when you visit Google’s website.Google Fiber is likely acquired by Verizon, since they would be getting brand-new fiber in very desirable service areas without legacy assets, though there would be a big fight among telcos for those assets.Widevine and reCaptcha might be sold to IBM, because they’re focusing a lot on AI and security lately.In theory, it sounds horrifying to imagine life without Google because everyone imagines all those services disappearing overnight. In practice, when companies go out of business, their assets get purchased and other companies continue operating their infrastructure, often under the same brand name for a while. If the transition goes smoothly, customers may barely even notice the change of ownership. There’s precedent for this kind of thing and there would be a lot of effort to keep all this infrastructure going during a transfer of power.

I will be shocked for sure but I am also sure that some other tech gaint, I am not mentioning their names here but you all know who and what will surely come up to fill the vacuum in not much time. The one thing that will happen for sure is finding things in a more organised way will be hard as other services are some what behind Google on that, it will be very easy to switch to other email systems, and I am sure that not much people will miss the Google+ or the Google  Translate, Google Drive will be very easily replaceable by dropbox, onedrive and such but the data stored will be lost as they this service would be stopped. The one and the most important thing that will happen is that sharing videos will not be the same never again with YouTube going out with Google. They have almost perfected the art of sharing videos and it will be hard for other services to offer what Google has been giving the users. As regards android, since it is free, the development would surely be taken up by some big corporations as they are sure about the profit returns, the community will be effected to some extend as there will or might be a change in the policy of using android but I am sure Android will grow with out Google supporting it. The profit of numerous services based on Google will fall or they might need to close down, those people who live with the Ads revenue from ADwords will have to change their earning methods. It is silly to even think of something like this as Google will be the first or will surely be involved in making the first AI that human race will encounter, the company have grown out of the stage of being stopped, they are on an spree of buying out companies, till date Google have bought more than 100 Companies that do things which we cannot even associate with Google.

Everyone will start using Bing, DuckDuck Go or some other search engines in place of Google Search.Chrome would be replaced by Firefox.Gmail would be replaced by Outlook, Rediffmail, Yahoo Mail and others.YouTube -> Vimeo, Dailymotion and many other sites.Google Docs would be replaced by Microsoft Office 360, Zoho Docs and others.likewise, Google Maps -> Bing Maps.Picasa -> Flickr.Android OS -> CyanogenMod, other custom ROMs.Blogger -> Wordpress and others.Google Drive -> Dropbox, Box, others.Google Analytics -> Clicky and other analytics services.Google+ -> Twitter, Instagram and others.In short, we would still be surrounded by same services, but from different companies. Also, it would affect the stock market, science and research (because of their Google X Project), various charities and other companies and services that are dependent upon Google.

If Google suddenly shut down for good it would take many businesses with it. Even though Bing provides similar services, the sites that rank well on Google often rank poorly on Bing. Entire businesses would suddenly find they'd lost nearly all of their revenue. As if losing Google search wouldn't be bad enough, losing AdWords / AdSense would be crushing for many publishers who rely on that revenue, and marketers who rely on that marketing channel. Sudden sharp drops in revenue would force a vicious cycle of firings, defaults on payments, and bankruptcies. Ironically I think the biggest winners would be SEO / SEM professionals who would suddenly be in enormous demand as companies scrambled to recoup some of their losses by trying to make the most of increased opportunities on Bing and elsewhere.

First remove this thought from your mind. This will never happen in real time. Might be due to bad luck or bad there is downtime for certain period of time for Google website. Actually I am 200 % sure that they already taken care of this type of situation and they have definitely backup plan for this situation. If they found main DNS name server is not able to pick request they will redirect all traffic some other name server. Also I believe they have world best site reliability team which make sure high availability and performance of Google server. In case if this happen, lot of things will be affected from the world. We even can not imagine this type of situation for 30 sec. also. Few countries have their own search engine. So people will use that search engine. Lot of things will happen if this kind of situation happen. People hit Google website to check whether their Internet is working or not? :)

I am assuming you mean if Google stops serving search traffic globally all of a sudden. My best guess is following things would happen: Twitter and Facebook traffic would increase dramatically with people screaming “OMG GOOGLE IS DOWN”Bing/Yahoo will get much more traffic, potentially bring them down as well.News about it be on a lot of headlines.Google employees would be working day and night to investigate what happened and make every effort to bring back the service online.Within 1 or 2 days, Google will be back online.

As a non technical person, I feel the needs google fulfills amongst all class of people like students businesses governments housewives children professionals is : easy accessibility to all sort of information:virtual needs being fulfilled via apps and games etc: connecting all kind of people together So Something new has to catch fancy of public to make Google shut down. Something new which could fulfill the need already created by search engines in a much better manner. Something which can read your mind and provide you answers without the help of a machine or hardware probably. I guess Google might re invent but not shut down. Nothing which keeps pace with changing needs or is able to create need in people of what it has to offer, ever shuts down But if it does, due to some unforeseen event, life would move on, people would find newer alternatives of information channel and would adapt though with a bit of difficulty initially. Definitely human beings are much bigger than Google Facebook etc..We make them, they don't make us.

There will be no Ghost Town to celebrate Halloween party. I’m referring to G+ It won’t have much impact in general. I believe some even had forgotten they had Google+ account since Google used to automatically create their profile when they signed up for Gmail. Their monthly active users are not so impressive too. Be it Google+, Facebook or any social platforms, the most affected ones will be the Marketers. If they solely depend on these platforms, they’ll be roasted dead meat hours after the shutdown.

Hmm… this is what I think would happen if Google went down even temporarily We’d be sick with Bing / Yahoo / … I don’t even know what else is there. Google is so good we won’t tolerate anything else, will we?We’d realize how little we really know about things. And we’d consider learning deeply.People who understand stuff deeply will feel awesome.We’d ask the person sitting next to us for answers to our questions. “How to go from Koramangala to Madiwala”.We’ll feel more humble… like… “I don’t really how much it costs” sort of way.

If google shut down nothing will happens people switch Google to yahoo for search optionUses facebook videos instead of youtubeUses yahoo,hot mail,outlook mail instead of gmailThey Uses microsoft map instead of google mapAnd they start buying iphone instead of androidPeople start storing there photos files document using amazon cloud ,or microsoft cloud devices instead of google driveThe above mention bold words all are google products….

GMail, Google Docs, Google Voice, and Google Apps - Basically, any of the "cloud" data stores that people rely on - would have the biggest impact if they went down. Google Search is easy enough to switch away from (most people have at least heard of alternative search engines, even if they don't use them regularly), but it's extremely difficult to really transition away when someone is hosting all your data.
Many computer programmers will realise they are not really programmers

Yahoo would skyrocket in popularity as well as other less popular search engines . Dailymotion and Vimeo would get more traffic because YouTube a google owned site would not exsist .  People would go to doctors instead of googling their symptoms,or ask Quora. People would find the Internet in general less simple to navigate and as a result producticity rates would increase greatly . Happy To Help !

Besides the google services there are other side effects Several people would lose internet access all together since there are services like google fiber and many people use google’s DNS on their networks without even knowing. Some websites would have users locked out of their accouts because many use google as a authentication provider Some services based on API from google would also be down, and worst of all: since it uses google maps POKEMON GO WOULD GO DOWN! lets hope that never happens…

For many of us, this is a huge opportunity cost. Lock-in of data. No other major providers who provide easy back up of data like Google takeout.No body else has built up a well validated secure system to store all our data - out of reach of even senior employees. (Ref: The yahoo data breach)No more safe place to store all the emails.No more well integrated apps - like contacts that merge with gmail, or gmail attachment that can be saved to Google Drive

Apocalypse for sure but then other companies would have to step up to provide things like Search, Advertising, Video on Demand like YouTube, a new mainstream mobile os. It could be major gains for any company to be honest and i’m betting Apple and Microsoft would be loving it. However, in a lot of ways it could hurt almost all companies as well as they depend on the likes of Android, Google Advertising, Search, etc to power a lot of their products and services.

It's not so easy to shut all services by such a big company because there are some protocol under industry rule which you have to follow even if you are owner of the company or it is private company.Even though if you think Google closes all the services then online life of people will become offline.

People would lose the ability to search simple things, there are only really bad alternatives. Free online storage is gone, email service with lots of addresses is gone, no easy translation, no maps, etc etc! It would be a huge disaster!

Google would lose its spot, it would take months for the company to rebuild its servers even though it would be undoubtedly funded by government billions with USA wanting to keep its name on the biggest search engine period. But in the end the public trust in Google would be diminished and it would slowly die, likely replaced by Bing (Eww).
Well,for one, people will learn to type the actual URL of the website they want to log in to.
For few days you will keep trying to open GOOGLE , even though google will not exist, it is our day to day habit of googling out … Slowly you will try other search engine like Bing/Yahoo/.././../

Probably google shuts down all the services will branch out with individual owners and would carry on the service and there are secondary brands to every Google service they will take over
I’d be very sad. I like my job. A much more interesting question to ponder is: What would have to happen first in order for Google to shut down?
Most stores would be able to reopen. Hiriering more people causing a larger decrease of unemployment. Google investersters would lose all their money.
My guess is that people would get sO frustrated that someone would develop a similar programme called FFIND or SSEARCH.
People would probably use other search engines, just like they did before google existed, and still do today…
Bing will thrive.
